data.title: Add extension cache for installed packages
data.body:
When #3761 was landed, there was an `extensions` object written to Atom's `package.json` file that was a map of extensions to files.

This was used to speed up load time of relative requires by knowing the extension ahead of time so one or more files wasn't stat-ed while it was being resolved.

Now that that has been released and appears to be having major upsides, add that same extension cache to all installed packages.

This should further reduce the count to `Module._findPath` for all the packages installed to `~/.atom/packages`.

These extensions will be added on the next `apm install` and `apm upgrade` for packages already installed, and can also be regenerated by running `apm rebuild-module-cache`.

data.title: Error building on fresh Windows 8.1 Pro VM
data.body:
In Parallels, after following the instructions, npm isn't available. This is probably an issue with the node installation (though `node` runs successfully), but logging here just in case the build instructions need to be enhanced after I figure out what happened.

```
C:\atom [master]> .\script\build
Node: v0.10.32
npm: v1.4.28
Python: v2.7.8
Installing build modules...
Error: ENOENT, stat 'C:\Users\daniel\AppData\Roaming\npm'

Installing apm...
The system cannot find the path specified.
```

data.title: Add support for scoped defaults in config schemas
data.body:
With this, schemas can specify defaults for scopes:

``` coffee
type: 'string'
default: 'ok'
scopes:
  '.source.js':
    default: 'omg' 
```

This structure allows for a separate schema for each scope in the future, but for now, I'm only using the `default` key.

Refs #3898

data.title: Swap out application menus on focus
data.body:
Now that package menus properly destroy themselves during deactivation, the window's application menu should be tracked and restored when the window gains focus.

Without this, a bunch of menus are getting destroyed when a window is closed, even if another window is still open.

Fixes #3806

data.title: No command line help no --version, no --help
data.body:
I run "atom --help" and get no help.

Could be a windows / shimgen issue.

I tried multiple shells including powershell, msys bash, cmd.

When I run it directly it works:

```
"C:\ProgramData\chocolatey\lib\Atom.0.138.0\tools\Atom\atom.exe" --help
[4888:1020/152630:INFO:CONSOLE(0)] Atom Editor v0.138.0

Usage: atom [options] [path ...]

One or more paths to files or folders to open may be specified.

File paths will open in the current window.

Folder paths will open in an existing window if that folder has already been
opened or a new window if it hasn't.

Options:
  -d, --dev             Run in development mode.                                             [boolean]
  -f, --foreground      Keep the browser process in the foreground.                          [boolean]
  -h, --help            Print this usage message.                                            [boolean]
  -l, --log-file        Log all output to file.                                              [string]
  -n, --new-window      Open a new window.                                                   [boolean]
  -s, --spec-directory  Set the spec directory (default: Atom's spec directory).             [string]
  --safe                Do not load packages from ~/.atom/packages or ~/.atom/dev/packages.  [boolean]
  -t, --test            Run the specified specs and exit with error code on failures.        [boolean]
  -v, --version         Print the version.                                                   [boolean]
  -w, --wait            Wait for window to be closed before returning.                       [boolean]
```

```
$ "C:\ProgramData\chocolatey\lib\Atom.0.138.0\tools\Atom\atom.exe" --version
[4440:1020/153010:INFO:CONSOLE(0)] 0.138.0

```

data.title: search not honoring excludeVcsIgnoredPaths option
data.body:
For example `node_modules` is ignored in my .gitignore file. Setting `excludeVcsIgnoredPaths` to true should make atom ignore that directory when searching but it still shows results from those files.

atom v0.138.0

data.title: Keybindings overwrite through the Preferences
data.body:
Hi there,

Instead of having to go to a separate code file to update the keybinding, a proper UX would have the keybindings settings all in one page.

We could have, for example, a tab that had the default sheet (the actual table) and a second tab that had custom bindings, where the user could configure what he ever wishes.

Is this planned for the near future?

Thanks in advance

data.title: Drag cursor selection with "alt"
data.body:
Hi there,

In Sublime Text, when you hold the "alt" key and click and drag the cursor, it will automatically create an instance of the cursor in the place where the cursor is touching (I suggest giving it a try, it is kind of complicated to explain).

Atom should have this, since it would be a big game changer for what it delivers in terms of speed coding flexibility :)

Is this planned for the near future?

Thanks in advance!

data.title: Support adjusting the size of split panel?
data.body: Currently the spilt panel is not able to be resized. Is there any ongoing plan or implementation? :)

data.title: "Object" config types which have dots in keys don't load correctly
data.body:
Script Runner has a config system which allows the user to specify custom regular expressions to match filenames and scopes for executing scripts. It looks a bit like this:

```
class ScriptRunner
  config:
    extensionMap:
      type: 'object'
      default:
        'spec.coffee': 'jasmine-node --coffee',
        'sh' : 'bash'
    scopeMap:
      type: 'object'
      default:
        '^source\.coffee': 'coffee'
        '^source\.js': 'node'
        '^source\.ruby': 'ruby'
        '^source\.python': 'python'
        '^source\.go': 'go run'
        '^text\.html\.php': 'php'
        'Shell Script (Bash)': 'bash'
```

The problem is, this doesn't appear to work. It looks like the objects don't get serialized correctly. The dots in the key names end up creating new children objects (incorrectly). This is a major bug for any package where the config is a hash and the keys have dots.

data.title: Atom doesn't load dev packages in dev mode
data.body:
I don't know if it was an intended change and I missed the announcement or if it's just a side effect of the changes in the ways packages are now loaded but Atom no longer loads packages from `~/.atom/dev/packages` when running with `--dev` option.

After running `atom --dev` to work on a package that is in my `~/github` directory and then symlinked in `~/.atom/dev/packages`, then I try the following in the console: 

```
minimap = atom.packages.getActivePackage('minimap')
=> Package {path: "/Users/cedric/.atom/packages/minimap", metadata: Object, emitter: Emitter, name: "minimap", stylesheets: Array[1]…}
```

As you can see the package version that is loaded is the one in `~/.atom/packages` and not the one from `dev`.

data.title: Atom loads too fast
data.body:
An annoying bug popped up in 0.138.0.  Atom is loading too fast.  I used to be able to check my comics on each debug cycle but now I have to work all the time.

Would you accept a pull request to add this somewhere?

```
for i in [0..9e9] then x = i
```

data.title: :checkered_flag: Backslash and At keys are ignored on German Windows 7
data.body: When using Atom (0.138.0 from zip download) on german Windows 7 with german keyboard layout the backslash (`\`) is entered with the <kbd>AltGr</kbd>+<kbd>ß</kbd> combination. In atom this does not enter the character in the text but swallow the keypress. <kbd>AltGr</kbd>+<kbd>q</kbd> (which produces the at (`@`) is also ignored).

data.title: backspace and delete key does not work on <input type="text"/>  and <textarea/> added by init script
Editor interprets some PHP array indices in strings as constants
data.body:
If I have this code:

``` PHP
<?php $test = "If you don't love {$arr[dess1]} and {$arr[dess2]} you're silly"; #ex8
```

The indices (dess1, dess2) are treated as constants though:
![](http://i.imgur.com/su1ugo7.png)

This is how Atom puts it in code (from the developer tools window):
![](http://i.imgur.com/cyQGWJ3.png)

data.title: Can't search across lines
data.body:
Both regex and normal find can't search across lines. E.g ``` something="ex ists"

blablablabla blablablabla

``` For the second example, a regex of `

.*

` should have matched the text. However, it does not work, because it is spread across two lines.

data.body:
I saw this reported in earlier this year (#2983), but I'm seeing the same problem now. 

While editing a file, then hitting CMD-z, the file is reverted to its original state (when the file was first opened that session). Redo is unresponsive.

Note: I don't have vim mode installed.

Version 0.138.0 (0.138.0)

It should have been included with this commit:

I don't think this is a real problem, but I think instead of just warning in the console, at-least a popup window should show and not opening the file? :) or just warn but still allow (stupid) people to open large files.

also: Are there any people thinking about how to handle the problem with big-files? I don't think most users will need to open files larger than 2 MB, but it would be nice to being able to open them them

data.body: It happened somewhere in https://github.com/atom/atom/compare/v0.137.0...v0.138.0

data.title: Ubuntu: Project root directory selecting issues.
data.body:
Did a fresh install on ubuntu.  However, when I try to open a directory to get a tree listing on the left, or set the default project directory in the preferences, both are ignored.  Instead, it only shows a project using my /home/userName/ folder as it's root.  This is somewhat problematic because there's a lot of unnecessary cruft in my home directory that get picked up (for instance, running a search makes it try to index).  And, of course, it's also a problem because I can't get a useful listing of files that -aren't- located in my home directory, and have an unusably long project file tree instead.

version: .deb version 0.138.0
Ubuntu version: Ubuntu 12.04.5 LTS (64 bit)
How to reproduce: Install the .deb from a directory under your /home/ folder.
developer console: No logged errors in the developer console.

data.title: Add GenericName to .desktop file
Add 'GenericName' to desktop file
data.body: Consider adding `GenericName=Text Editor` to Linux desktop file. KDE (and probably other DE) use it e.g. when hoovering icon on quick launch panel.

data.title: Allow core specs from command line in atom repository regardless of its location
data.body:
Previously, when running `apm test` inside the package directory worked fine because it set the `spec-directory` argument to the executable and just ran the core specs. However, if the repository was located somewhere other than `~/github/atom` and no `ATOM_DEV_RESOURCE_PATH` environment variable was defined, it would _first_ load a bunch of core files out of the application bundle. Now that we're using custom elements, these leads to errors due to redundant element definition, so we need a new approach.

Now when you run `apm test` in the atom repository, we will automatically assign the resource path to the directory containing the specs unless one is otherwise specified.

Closes #3872

/cc @kevinsawicki since you are the lord of startup. :snowflake::boot:

data.title: Add Option to "Do Nothing" when Atom Becomes Active
data.body: Right now, Atom opens a blank file at launch. It would be great if users had the option to do nothing when Atom becomes active (i.e., don't open a blank file at launch). Many other text editors have this option, so it seems a bit odd that Atom doesn't.

data.title: apm rebuild-module-cache aborts on error
data.body: When I got an error from `apm rebuild-module-cache` because of an empty directory it dropped out and quit processing,
